definition: body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158
double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time

sentences.english: Tina needs money. She now wears several hats to make her ends meet.
sentences.chinese: 蒂娜需要錢，我現在身兼數職，賺取生活所需的錢。

sentences.english: Indeed, many ultitaskers enjoy their active lives.
sentences.chinese: 的確，許多身兼數職者喜歡積極的生活。

sentences.english: He works two jobs but he always shows upbeat energy when he faces the hotel guests.
sentences.chinese: 身兼兩份工作，卻總精神奕奕地服務飯店房客。

sentences.english: Even Spielberg, who wears many hats, sees the efficacy of digital.
sentences.chinese: 就算是身兼數職的史匹柏，也見識到了數位的效率。

sentences.english: The number of people pursuing something on the side is constantly growing.
sentences.chinese: 如今身兼數職的人的數量正在不斷地上漲。

sentences.english: And we need to notice that Private Secretaries usually played different roles in daily life.
sentences.chinese: 應該注意的是，在實際生活中幕友往往身兼多個角色。

sentences.english: The company is short-handed these days. I have to wear two hats.
sentences.chinese: 公司這些天缺人手，我只好身兼兩職。

sentences.english: He wears two hats as a business owner and as president of the Chamber of Commerce.
sentences.chinese: 他身兼雙職，既是商業老闆又是商會主席。

sentences.english: You are an impatient person who always has several irons in the fire.
sentences.chinese: 同時，你也是個沒耐心的人，將會一直身兼多職。

sentences.english: Lastly, you want to be able to wear many hats if possible.
sentences.chinese: 最後，如果可能的話，你希望自己能身兼數職。

sentences.english: As both a clinician and researcher, Orser focuses on improving patient safety.
sentences.chinese: 身兼醫師及研究員，歐瑟致力於增進病人的安全。

definition: to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
double/twice/simultaneous/holding two or more (official) posts at the same time
to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
first person to be appointed to a post
to be proficient in/to master (a subject)
special duty/assigned full time to a task
to shoulder (a burden)/to bear/to suffer (a disadvantage)
to take up duty as/to assume a position/to assume/to take on (an office)
